work.name: Strava
work.summary: Summer internship focused on page migration with React, and API development with Ruby on Rails.
highlights: Removed ~7,000 lines of legacy code by migrating web pages to a micro-frontend architecture.
Learned CI best practices, using Canary testing on production data, merged/deployed code from continuous integration application, “Butler”.
Created API endpoints for video uploads, enabling advertising partner engagement.
Reduced application bundle sizes through publication of an NPM formatters package.
Used Agile methodology combined with Jira, GitHub, and FigJam to collaborate with geographically diverse scrum teams.

work.name: Deep Dive Coding, CNM Ingenuity
work.description: Full Stack JavaScript / React / Node Bootcamp
highlights: Provided tutoring and technical support for over 25 student web applications built with React, Node, and PostgreSQL.
Contributed technical presentations, mock interview support and in class assistance for students.

work.name: Daniel B. Stephens & Assoc.
work.description: Microsoft Excel / Microsoft Access / SQL / ArcMap GIS / Technical Writing / Data Analysis
work.summary: Environmental compliance and ground water monitoring support
highlights: Managed groundwater chemistry databases, using Microsoft Access & Excel.
Prioritized tasks and organized operations for field teams, managed changes in project scope and developed contingency plans.
Interpreted data and summarized findings for regulatory reports.
Planned curriculum for New Mexico water system operator certification.

volunteer.summary: Focused on unifying developer groups by building partnerships with local businesses, programming workshops and organizing social gatherings for developers in Albuquerque.
Assists in organizing networking, educational and outreach opportunities for Deep Dive graduates and local employers.

education.studyType: 400-hour, project focused, web development boot camp simulating the SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle).

references.name: Elisa Valdez de Ramírez - Software Engineering Manager
references.reference: “I had the great fortune of managing Michael during his internship at Strava. Throughout that time he demonstrated an ability to learn and adapt quickly, thriving in the ambiguity that comes with starting at a new company and learning the ropes of how things work there. He is incredibly hard working, dedicated to constant growth, and a general joy to be around. Myself and all of his teammates really enjoyed having him on the team. Technically, Michael tackled two large projects during his internship. One on the frontend, public facing website and the other on the server side as part of our public API made available to partners. In both projects he helped scope, design, and implement work in several areas of Strava's code bases. He took on learning new languages, frameworks, and architecture patterns with eagerness and enthusiasm, walking that line of knowing when to ask to help but trying all solutions before he reached out. His contributions have made an impact to Strava as a company and the team(s) he worked with.”

projects.name: Abq Tool Shed
highlights: Backend - TypeScript / Node / mySQL / Express / Docker

projects.name: Fantasy football league blog
projects.description: Fantasy league blog for learning data analytics with Python, NumPy and Seaborn
